metadata.title: CVE-2023-1729 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in LibRaw. A heap-buffer-overflow in raw2image_ex() causedby a maliciously crafted file may lead to an application crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.04.1
libraw20 - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.04.1
No subscription required

digikam - 4:7.5.0-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
digikam-data - 4:7.5.0-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
digikam-private-libs - 4:7.5.0-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
showfoto - 4:7.5.0-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libraw package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.04.1').
darktable package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
digikam package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:7.5.0-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
